title: From the Earth to the moon; and, round the moon
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905

quoteFirst: Beer being chairman. On the main question being put, the measure was approved by
quoteLast: votes. The report of the committee was then received, and the bill engrossed under the title of “An act to authorize the construction of a railway through Prince Edward Island.” Thus, in two days from the time of its introduction, the bill received the sanction of the assembly; and it may be safely affirmed that few measures have ever been passed by the representatives of the people of greater importance, as bearing on the material interests of the island.
title: History of Prince Edward Island
author: Campbell, Duncan, 1819?-1886

title: From the Earth to the Moon, Direct in Ninety-Seven Hours and Twenty Minutes: and a Trip Round It
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905; Hildibrand, Henri Théophile, 1824-1897 [Engraver]; Bayard, Émile Antoine, 1837-1891 [Illustrator]; Neuville, Alphonse Marie de, 1835-1885 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: Rates were promptly cut during 1905 by both sets of lines. Thus the rate on export corn from Omaha to New Orleans was reduced from
quoteLast: cents per hundred pounds. This cut was promptly met by a reduction of rates from Missouri river points to Chicago from twenty-four to thirteen cents.
title: Railroads: Rates and Regulations
author: Ripley, William Zebina, 1867-1941

quoteFirst: The incident started when the pilot of an Air Force C-54 transport radioed Goose AFB and said that at
quoteLast: a large fireball had buzzed his airplane. It had come in from behind the C-54, and nobody had seen it until it was just off the left wing.
title: The Report on Unidentified Flying Objects
author: Ruppelt, Edward J., 1922-1960
